name: biomni-get-genes-near-ccre
title: Biomni: Get Genes Near Ccre
description: Find the k nearest genes to a candidate cis-Regulatory Element (cCRE) from the ENCODE SCREEN database.
content:
Overview

Retrieves the k nearest genes to a specified candidate cis-Regulatory Element (cCRE) from the ENCODE SCREEN database. cCREs are DNA regions identified by ENCODE as likely regulatory elements based on chromatin accessibility and histone modification patterns.

Input Parameters

  • accession (string, required): The cCRE accession identifier from ENCODE SCREEN
  • assembly (string, required): Genome assembly version (e.g., "GRCh38" or "mm10")
  • chromosome (string, required): Chromosome name (e.g., "chr1", "chr2")
  • k (integer, optional): Number of nearest genes to retrieve (default: 10)

Biological Use Case

Essential for identifying potential gene targets of regulatory elements. Researchers use this to link regulatory regions to nearby genes for studies of gene regulation, enhancer-gene interactions, and understanding how genetic variants in regulatory regions may affect gene expression. This is particularly important for interpreting GWAS hits and understanding disease mechanisms.

Output

Returns a parameters (genes_near_ccre.json) containing a list of the k nearest genes with their names, genomic coordinates, distances from the cCRE, strand information, and additional gene annotations.
